paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a novel mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with long-QT syndrome type 2.

patients.phenotype: long-QT syndrome type 2 with recurrent syncope during sexual activity

individual_records.phenotype_details: recurrent syncope during sexual activity, torsades de pointes
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 24-year-old Caucasian woman... presented with recurrent syncope during sexual activity.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a change in the reading frame at codon Ala121 and the introduction of a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: The patient's father showed an abnormal LQT-interval but never experienced a cardiac event.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is novel and has not been previously reported in the context of orgasm-induced TdP.
key_quotes: A ‘c.361del-mutation’ in the KCNH2 gene... is associated with the LQT syndrome type 2.
This mutation leads to a change in the reading frame at codon Ala121 and the introduction of a premature stop codon.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
